 1462: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1463: basic_rsa_1024() ->
 1464:     [{doc, "TLS 1.3 (Basic): Test if connection can be established using 1024 bits RSA keys in certificates."}].
 1465: 
 1466: basic_rsa_1024(Config) ->
 1467:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_1024_opts, Config),
 1468:     ServerOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_1024_opts, Config),
 1469:     ServerOpts1 = [{versions, ['tlsv1.2','tlsv1.3']}|ServerOpts0],
 1470:     ClientOpts = [{versions, ['tlsv1.2','tlsv1.3']}|ClientOpts0],
 1471:     ServerOpts = [{verify, verify_peer},
 1472:                   {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true} | ServerOpts1],
 1473:     ssl_test_lib:basic_test(ClientOpts, ServerOpts, Config).
 1474: 
 1475: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1476: server_certificate_authorities_disabled() ->
 1477:      [{doc,"TLS 1.3: Disabling certificate_authorities extension on the server when verify_peer is set to true"
 1478:        " allows the client to send a chain that could be verifiable by the server but that would not adhere to"
 1479:        " the certificate_authorities extension as it is not part of the regular trusted certificate set"}].
 1480: 
 1481: server_certificate_authorities_disabled(Config) ->
 1482:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_cert_opts, Config),
 1483:     ServerOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_cert_opts, Config),
 1484: 
 1485:     % Strip out the ClientRoot to simulate cases where the they are manually managed and
 1486:     % not expected to be included in certificate requests during mutual authentication.
 1487:     {ok, CACerts0} = ssl_pkix_db:decode_pem_file(proplists:get_value(cacertfile, ServerOpts0)),
 1488:     [_ClientRoot | ServerCACerts] = [CertDER || {_, CertDER, _} <- CACerts0],
 1489: 
 1490:     FunAndState =  {fun(_,{extension, _}, UserState) ->
 1491:                             {unknown, UserState};
 1492:                        (_, valid, UserState) ->
 1493:                             {valid, UserState};
 1494:                        % Because this is a manually managed setup, we also need to manually verify
 1495:                        % an unknown_ca (ClientCert) as expected. Typically you would have custom logic
 1496:                        % here to decide if you know the cert (like looking up pinned values in a DB)
 1497:                        % but for testing purposes, we'll allow everything
 1498:                        (_, {bad_cert, unknown_ca}, UserState) ->
 1499:                             {valid, UserState};
 1500:                        (_, valid_peer, UserState) ->
 1501:                             {valid, UserState}
 1502:                     end, [0]},
 1503: 
 1504:     ClientOpts = [{versions, ['tlsv1.3']}, {verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts0],
 1505:     ServerOpts = [{versions, ['tlsv1.3']}, {verify, verify_peer},
 1506:                   {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true}, {cacerts, ServerCACerts},
 1507:                   {verify_fun, FunAndState} | ServerOpts0],
 1508:     ssl_test_lib:basic_alert(ClientOpts, ServerOpts, Config, certificate_required),
 1509:     ssl_test_lib:basic_test(ClientOpts, [{certificate_authorities, false} | ServerOpts], Config).
 1510: 
 1511: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1512: legacy_server_certificate_authorities_disabled() ->
 1513:      [{doc,"Test that code pre TLS-1.3 can send an empty list for certificate authorities in the certificate request"
 1514:        "will be run and not fail, black box verification is not possible without strict legacy client, but code coverage will show that right thing happens"}].
 1515: 
 1516: legacy_server_certificate_authorities_disabled(Config) ->
 1517:     Version = proplists:get_value(version,Config),
 1518:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_cert_opts, Config),
 1519:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_cert_opts, Config),
 1520:     ssl_test_lib:basic_test([{versions, [Version]} | ClientOpts], [{versions, [Version]}, {verify, verify_peer},
 1521:                                                                   {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true},
 1522:                                                                   {certificate_authorities, false} | ServerOpts], Config).
 1523: 
 1524: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1525: %% Internal functions  -----------------------------------------------
 1526: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1527: rsa_alg(rsa_pss_rsae_1_3) ->
 1528:     rsa_pss_rsae;
 1529: rsa_alg(rsa_pss_pss_1_3) ->
 1530:     rsa_pss_pss;
 1531: rsa_alg(Atom) ->
 1532:     Atom.
 1533: 
 1534: no_reuse(?TLS_1_3) ->
 1535:     [];
 1536: no_reuse(_) ->
 1537:     [{reuse_sessions, false}].
 1538: 
 1539: chain_and_root(Config) ->
 1540:     OwnCert = proplists:get_value(cert, Config),
 1541:     {ok, ExtractedCAs} = ssl_pkix_db:extract_trusted_certs({der, proplists:get_value(cacerts, Config)}),
 1542:     {ok, Root, Chain} = ssl_certificate:certificate_chain(OwnCert, ets:new(foo, []), ExtractedCAs, [], encoded),
 1543:     {Chain, Root}.
 1544: 
 1545: 
 1546: positive_extended_keyusage(ClientOpts0, ServerOpts0, Config) ->
 1547:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(extra_client, ClientOpts0, Config),
 1548:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(extra_server, ServerOpts0, Config),
 1549: 
 1550:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1551:     Version = proplists:get_value(version, Config),
 1552:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1553: 					{from, self()},
 1554:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1555:                                         {options, no_reuse(ssl_test_lib:n_version(Version)) ++
 1556:                                              [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1557:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1558:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1559: 					{host, Hostname},
 1560:                                         {from, self()},
 1561:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1562: 					{options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
 1563: 
 1564:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1565: 
 1566:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1567:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
 1568: 
 1569: negative_extended_keyusage(ClientOpts0, ServerOpts0, Config) ->
 1570:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(extra_client, ClientOpts0, Config),
 1571:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(extra_server, ServerOpts0, Config),
 1572: 
 1573:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1574:     Version = proplists:get_value(version, Config),
 1575:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1576:                                               {from, self()},
 1577:                                               {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
 1578:                                               {options, [{verify, verify_peer},
 1579:                                                          {fail_if_no_peer_cert, true}] ++
 1580:                                                    no_reuse(ssl_test_lib:n_version(Version)) ++ ServerOpts
 1581:                                               }]),
 1582:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1583:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1584:                                               {host, Hostname},
 1585:                                               {from, self()},
 1586:                                               {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
 1587:                                               {options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
 1588: 
 1589:     ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, Client, unsupported_certificate).
